issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I have a simple POC setup with imaging services configured. When I go to the Auto-Scaling page and click on the image worker group, it trigger an "Internal Server Error".

{noformat}
2015-01-21 14:23:59 ERROR Error handling request
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/async.py", line 45, in handle
    self.handle_request(listener, req, client, addr)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/gunicorn/ggevent.py", line 154, in handle_request
    super(GeventWorker, self).handle_request(*args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/async.py", line 93, in handle_request
    respiter = self.wsgi(environ, resp.start_response)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 251, in __call__
    response = self.invoke_subrequest(request, use_tweens=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 227, in invoke_subrequest
    response = handle_request(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 80, in __call__
    response = self.handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 53, in tween
    response = handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 42, in tween
    response = handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/tweens.py", line 21, in excview_tween
    response = handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 161, in handle_request
    response = view_callable(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 237, in _secured_view
    return view(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 345, in rendered_view
    result = view(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 462, in _class_requestonly_view
    inst = view(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/views/launchconfigs.py", line 235, in __init__
    profile_name = arn[(arn.rindex('/')+1):]
ValueError: substring not found
{noformat}

Also, I noticed on my system that the imaging service autoscaling groups isn't working (i.e. no instances are being launched in that group).
fields.summary: Selecting an autoscaling group results in "Internal Server Error"

comments.body:
when clicking on the link under "NAME" for the imaging service scaling group, you get this error.

My system is left in that state at the moment. IP address is http://10.111.1.73 and login is admin/foobar.
[~dkavanagh], can you take a look at this.
Correction. My NC was down and this is why my imaging instance wasn't started but now that everything is back online, the GUI still throws the same error.
[~chuck]: Is the error restricted to the image service AS group, or are all autoscaling groups affected?
[~kgill], I do not have any other scaling group installed so I cannot answer this question for sure.
[~kgill], I just created another launch-config and verified that it work ok with the GUI. So this looks like its limited to the image service AS group.
From the error I would assume that the issue occurs for any launch configuration that specifies an instance profile.

I created a launch config with a role. I then created a scaling group using that launch config. I had no problem navigating around the autoscaling pages (landing/detail). I was a non-euca account admin. I'll try as euca/admin with imaging group. How do I get the imaging worker scaling group going? Do I have to initiate some kind of image import operation?

Ran into problem setting up the imaging worker (from IRC):
"I'm running "euca-install-imaging-worker --install-default" as the euca/admin
It fails with an error from euca-bundle-and-upload-image
euca-bundle-and-upload-image: error: missing certificate; please supply one with -c
seems like something I can't influence, but I assume something is amiss with the setup."
You can delete the existing certificates for the user (euare-userdelcert) and download new credentials (euca-get-credentials) that contain a signing certificate used for image bundling.

I got the imaging worker installed and running (via euca-import-volume). I'm able to view the scaling group detail page: http://localhost:8888/scalinggroups/asg-euca-internal-imaging-worker-01
I've switched between all 3 tabs and no issues to report. This is a source install of the maint-4.1 branch.

Ah, I found the actual problem. It's not the autoscaling group, it's the launch config! It was shown in the image once I looked at it.

http://localhost:8888/launchconfigs/lc-euca-internal-imaging-worker-01

The problem is that the instance profile name is not an ARN like with the other configs. It's simply set to imaging-worker-01. I see this problem with other launch configs for ELBs. 
Looking at the CreateLaunchConfiguration docs;
IamInstanceProfile
The name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile associated with the IAM role for the instance.

That means this is reasonable and I'll have to adjust our code in case an ARN is not provided.

IIRC when getting data from the auto scaling service the LaunchConfigurationARN would be the ARN and the LaunchConfigurationName would be the name.

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeLaunchConfigurations.html
The issue was when a role is assigned, so the instance profile name.
tests passed, though CI status in git not reflecting it.
